remarks: If two structures have the same components (properties), one is an associative algebra iff the other one is.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.)
statement:
assapropd.1 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
assapropd.2 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
assapropd.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
assapropd.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .r ` K ) y ) = ( x ( .r ` L ) y ) ) $.
assapropd.5 $e |- ( ph -> F = ( Scalar ` K ) ) $.
assapropd.6 $e |- ( ph -> F = ( Scalar ` L ) ) $.
assapropd.7 $e |- P = ( Base ` F ) $.
assapropd.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. P /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .s ` K ) y ) = ( x ( .s ` L ) y ) ) $.
assapropd $p |- ( ph -> ( K e. AssAlg <-> L e. AssAlg ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d P x y $.
$d ph x y $.
